intro: Calamus ciliaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calamus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, often forming dense stands. The plant features long, slender stems that are often used in basket weaving and other traditional crafts. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a smooth texture and a subtle fragrance. Calamus ciliaris produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually clustered in spadices, typical of the palm family.
